position.marginalia_text: Sic se habet sol, in corporibus, quemadmodu[m] Sol in stellis. Suo enim Lumine, & splendore omnia com[m]utabilia germinat, et o[mn]es fructus perficit nutu dei.

marginalia.translation: Thus the sun is found among other bodies just as the sun is found among stars. For by its light and splendor all changeable things pair up and all fruits are accomplished by the will of God.

position.marginalia_text: quo genito, nihil aliud est qua[m] opus mulieru[m] & ludus Puerorum. Item notetis quod Ingressio, Summersio, Coniunctio, Connexio, Complexio, Compositio & Mixtio idem significant in hac arte. Nihil enim ingreditur &c

marginalia.translation: Thus once it is born, it is nothing more than women's work and a child's game. Also, you shall note that ingression, submergence, conjuncture, connection, complexion and composition mean one thing in this art, unless it is mixed first.
